intro: Cleistocactus chacoanus var. santacruzensis, commonly known as the Santa Cruz cleistocactus, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces small, white flowers that open at night, a feature typical of many nocturnal blooming cacti. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring minimal water and well-draining soil. This variety is valued for its unique appearance and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
